data.title: NEOOUG 2010 Oracle Data Integrator Presentation
data.meta_description: NEOOUG 2010 Oracle Data Integrator Presentation - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Oracle Data Integrator NEOOUG May 21, 2010 Ankit Jain

2. Agenda ( Or how long do I have to stay here ) What is ODI ? Why do I need ODI ? Architecture (ELT and ODI) ODI Modules Peek into Knowledge Modules Wrap Up

3. What is ODI ? Java based Integration tool Metadata driven Support for heterogeneous technologies Support for standard tools Standard Data Integration functions

4. Why do I need ODI ? I want a Unified view of Information I want to focus on the Business Logic I want to implement processes in a standard way Data Sources CRM Legacy ERP Custom Database Files / XML ESB Targets Custom DB Apps Data Warehouse Files / XML ESB Staging Area Any DB

5. E-LT Architecture Conventional: Separate ETL Server Proprietary ETL Engine Poor Performance High Costs for Separate Standalone Server Oracle: No New Servers Lower Cost: Leverage Compute Resources & Partition Workload efficiently Efficient: Exploits Database Optimizer Fast: Exploits Native Bulk Load & Other Database Interfaces Scalable: Scales as you add Processors to Source or Target Benefits Optimal Performance & Scalability Better Hardware Leverage Easier to Manage & Lower Cost Conventional ETL Architecture E xtract L oad T ransform ODI ELT Architecture “ E-LT ” L oad E xtract Transform T ransform

7. ODI – 4 Modules

8. Topology/Security Manager Define the physical and logical architecture of the infrastructure Specify user credentials and their access rights All the above information is stored in the master repository

9. Topology (Continued)

10. Topology (Physical/Logical Architecture) The logical view describes logical schemas that represent the physical schemas of the existing applications independently of their physical implementation. These logical schemas are then linked to the physical resources through contexts. Designers always refer to the logical view defined in the Topology. All development done therefore becomes independent of the physical location of the resources.

11. Physical vs. Logical Architecture Contexts Boston Japan Physical Architecture Logical Architecture SALES DB_BOSTON SALES DB_TOKYO LG_SALES Visible Invisible Plumbing

12. Designer (Models) Define the blueprint of the source and target datastores Apply constraints on the columns (PK, FK or any condition) Define SCD behavior of the columns

13. Designer (Projects)

14. Operator

15. Extensible Knowledge Modules Provided out of the box and are user extensible Written for specific source/target platforms

16. KMs -What’s below the surface ? update <%=snpRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")%> set IND_UPDATE = 'N' where exists ( select 'X' from <%=snpRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A")%> <%=snpRef.getInfo("DEST_TAB_ALIAS_WORD")%> T where <%=snpRef.getColList("", snpRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")+".[COL_NAME]= T.[COL_NAME]", "and", "", "UK")%> <%=snpRef.getColList("and", "(("+snpRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")+".[COL_NAME] = T.[COL_NAME]) or ("+snpRef.getTable("L", "INT_NAME", "A")+".[COL_NAME] IS NULL and T.[COL_NAME] IS NULL))", " and", "", "((UPD and !TRG) and !UK)")%> ) update I$_TRG_CITY set IND_UPDATE = 'N' where exists ( select 'X' from TRG_CITY T where I$_TRG_CITY.CITY_ID = T.CITY_ID and ((I$_TRG_CITY.REGION_ID = T.REGION_ID) or (I$_TRG_CITY.REGION_ID IS NULL and T.REGION_ID IS NULL)) and ((I$_TRG_CITY.CITY = T.CITY) or (I$_TRG_CITY.CITY IS NULL and T.CITY IS NULL)) and ((I$_TRG_CITY.POPULATION = T.POPULATION) or (I$_TRG_CITY.POPULATION IS NULL and T.POPULATION IS NULL)) ) Built at runtime

17. More Features Data Quality Change Data Capture Slowly Changing Dimensions Bulk Load Support for Functions, procedures, etc Data Lineage

18. Best Practices Define conventions early in the game Define Security policy Repository IDs should be unique Create different contexts for different OS Do NOT add business logic to the KM Documentation Documentation Documentation Documentation

19. ODI – Getting Started Where to download http://www.oracle.com/technology/software/products/odi/index.html What to install Current version 10.1.3.5 You can get a patch to upgrade to 10.1.3.6.2

20. OTN – Data Integration Forum
